h1601.definition: feminine active participle of {{h1600}}; lowing; Goah, a place near Jerusalem; Goath.

h1602.definition: a primitive root; to detest; by implication, to reject; abhor, fail, lothe, vilely cast away.

h1603.definition: from {{h1602}}; loathing; Gaal, an Israelite; Gaal.

h1605.definition: a primitive root; to chide; corrupt, rebuke, reprove.

h1607.definition: a primitive root; to agitate violently; move, shake, toss, trouble.

h1608.definition: from {{h1607}}; a quaking; Gaash, a hill in Palestine; Gaash.

h1609.definition: of uncertain derivation; Gatam, an Edomite; Gatam.

h1610.definition: from an unused root meaning to arch; the back; by extension the body or self; highest places, himself.

h1612.definition: from an unused root meaning to bend; a vine (as twining), especially the grape; vine, tree.

h1613.definition: from an unused root, probably meaning to house in; a kind of tree or wood (as used for building), apparently the cypress; gopher.

h1614.definition: probably feminine of {{h1613}}; properly, cypress-resin; by analogy, sulphur (as equally inflammable); brimstone.

h1615.definition: perhaps from {{h3564}}; lime (from being burned in a kiln); chalk(-stone).

h1616.definition: or (fully) geyr (gare); from {{h1481}}; properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner; alien, sojourner, stranger.

h1617.definition: perhaps from {{h1626}}; a grain; Gera, the name of six Israelites; Gera.

h1618.definition: from an unused root meaning to scratch; scurf (from itching); scab, scurvy.

h1619.definition: from the same as {{h1618}}; scabby; Gareb, the name of an Israelite, also of a hill near Jerusalem; Gareb.

h1620.definition: by reduplication from {{h1641}}; a berry (as if a pellet of rumination); berry.

h1621.definition: feminine plural from {{h1641}}; the throat (as used in rumination); neck.

h1622.definition: patrial from an unused name (of uncertain derivation); a Girgashite, one of the native tribes of Canaan; Girgashite, Girgasite.

h1623.definition: a primitive root; to abrade; scrape.

h1624.definition: a primitive root; properly, to grate, i.e. (figuratively) to anger; contend, meddle, stir up, strive.

h1625.definition: from {{h1641}}; the cud (as scraping the throat); cud.

h1626.definition: from {{h1641}} (as in {{h1625}}); properly, (like {{h1620}}) a kernel (round as if scraped), i.e.; a gerah or small weight (and coin); gerah.

h1627.definition: or (shortened) גָּרֹן; from {{h1641}}; (compare {{h1621}}); the throat (as roughened by swallowing); × aloud, mouth, neck, throat.

h1629.definition: a primitive root; to cut off; cut off.

h1630.definition: plural of an unused noun from {{h1629}} (compare {{h1511}}), cut up (i.e. rocky); Gerizim, a mountain of Palestine; Gerizim.

h1632.definition: from the same as {{h1486}}; harsh; man of great (as in the margin which reads {{h1419}}).

h1633.definition: a primitive root; to be spare or skeleton-like; used only as a denominative from {{h1634}}; (causative) to bone, i.e. denude (by extensive, craunch) the bones; gnaw the bones, break.

h1634.definition: from {{h1633}}; a bone (as the skeleton of the body); hence, self, i.e. (figuratively) very; bone, strong, top.

h1637.definition: from an unused root meaning to smooth; a threshing-floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area; (barn, corn, threshing-) floor, (threshing-, void) place.

h1638.definition: a primitive root; to crush; also (intransitively and figuratively) to dissolve; break.

h1639.definition: a primitive root; to scrape off; by implication, to shave, remove, lessen, withhold; abate, clip, (di-) minish, do (take) away, keep back, restrain, make small, withdraw.

h1640.definition: a primitive root; to bear off violently; sweep away.

h1641.definition: a primitive root; to drag off roughly; by implication, to bring up the cud (i.e. ruminate); by analogy, to saw; catch, chew, × continuing, destroy, saw.

h1642.definition: probably from {{h1641}}; a rolling country; Gerar, a Philistine city; Gerar.

h1643.definition: from an unused root meaning to husk; a kernel (collectively), i.e. grain; beaten corn.

h1644.definition: a primitive root; to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce; cast up (out), divorced (woman), drive away (forth, out), expel, × surely put away, trouble, thrust out.

h1645.definition: from {{h1644}}; produce (as if expelled); put forth.

h1646.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h1644}}; (abstractly) dispossession; exaction.

h1647.definition: for {{h1648}}; Gereshom, the name of four Israelites; Gershom.

h1648.definition: or גֵּרְשׁוֹם; from {{h1644}}; a refugee; Gereshon or Gereshom, an Israelite; Gershon, Gershom.

h1649.definition: patronymically from {{h1648}}; a Gereshonite or descendant of Gereshon; Gershonite, sons of Gershon.

h1650.definition: from an unused root (meaning to join); bridge; Geshur, a district of Syria; Geshur, Geshurite.

h1651.definition: patrial from {{h1650}}; a Geshurite (also collectively) or inhabitants of Geshur; Geshuri, Geshurites.

h1652.definition: a primitive root; to shower violently; (cause to) rain.

h1654.definition: or (prolonged) גַּשְׁמוּ; the same as {{h1653}}; Geshem or Gashmu, an Arabian; Geshem, Gashmu.

h1655.definition: (Aramaic) apparently the same as {{h1653}}; used in a peculiar sense, the body (probably for the (figuratively) idea of a hard rain); body.

h1657.definition: probably of Egyptian origin; Goshen, the residence of the Israelites in Egypt; also a place in Palestine; Goshen.

h1658.definition: of uncertain derivation; Gishpa, an Israelite; Gispa.

h1659.definition: a primitive root; apparently; to feel about; grope.

h1660.definition: probably from {{h5059}} (in the sense of treading out grapes); a wine-press (or vat for holding the grapes in pressing them); (wine-) press (fat).

h1661.definition: the same as {{h1660}}; Gath, a Philistine city; Gath.

h1662.definition: or (abridged) גִּתָּה־חֵפֶר; from {{h1660}} and {{h2658}} with the article inserted; wine-press of (the) well; Gath-Chepher, a place in Palestine; Gath-kephr, Gittah-kephr.

h1663.definition: patrial from {{h1661}}; a Gittite or inhabitant of Gath; Gittite.

h1664.definition: dual of {{h1660}}; double winepress; Gittajim, a place in Palestine; Gittaim.

h1665.definition: feminine of {{h1663}}; a Gittite harp; Gittith.

h1666.definition: of uncertain derivation; Gether, a son of Aram, and the region settled by him; Gether.

h1667.definition: from {{h1660}} and {{h7416}}; wine-press of (the) pomegranate; Gath-Rimmon, a place in Palestine; Gath-rimmon. d

h1669.definition: a primitive root; to pine; mourn, sorrow(-ful).

h1670.definition: from {{h1669}}; properly, pining; by analogy, fear; sorrow.

h1672.definition: a primitive root; be anxious; be afraid (careful, sorry), sorrow, take thought.

h1673.definition: or (fully) דּוֹאֵג; active participle of {{h1672}}; anxious; Doeg, an Edomite; Doeg.

h1674.definition: from {{h1672}}; anxiety; care(-fulness), fear, heaviness, sorrow.

h1675.definition: a primitive root; to dart, i.e. fly rapidly; fly.

h1676.definition: from {{h1675}}; the kite (from its rapid flight); vulture. See {{h7201}}.

h1677.definition: or (fully) דּוֹב; from {{h1680}}; the bear (as slow); bear.

h1679.definition: from an unused root (compare {{h1680}}) (probably meaning to be sluggish, i.e. restful); quiet; strength.

h1680.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1679}}); to move slowly, i.e. glide; cause to speak.

h1681.definition: from {{h1680}} (in the sense of furtive motion); slander; defaming, evil report, infamy, slander.

h1682.definition: or (shortened) דְּבֹרָה; from {{h1696}} (in the sense of orderly motion); the bee (from its systematic instincts); bee.

h1683.definition: or (shortened) דְּבֹרָה; the same as {{h1682}}; Deborah, the name of two Hebrewesses; Deborah.

h1684.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2076}}; to sacrifice (an animal); offer (sacrifice).

h1686.definition: in the margin for the textual reading, חֶרְיוֹן; both, (in the plural only and) of uncertain derivation,; probably some cheap vegetable, perhaps a bulbous root; dove's dung.

h1687.definition: or (shortened) דְּבִר; from {{h1696}} (apparently in the sense of oracle); the shrine or innermost part of the sanctuary; oracle.

h1688.definition: or (shortened) דְּבִר; (Joshua 13:26 (but see {{h3810}})), the same as {{h1687}}; Debir, the name of an Amoritish king and of two places in Palestine; Debir.

h1689.definition: probably an orthographical error for {{h7247}}; Diblah, a place in Syria; Diblath.

h1690.definition: from an unused root (akin to {{h2082}}) probably meaning to press together; a cake of pressed figs; cake (lump) of figs.

h1691.definition: dual from the masculine of {{h1690}}; two cakes; Diblajim, a symbolic name; Diblaim.

h1692.definition: a primitive root; properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit; abide fast, cleave (fast together), follow close (hard after), be joined (together), keep (fast), overtake, pursue hard, stick, take.

h1693.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1692}}; to stick to; cleave.

h1694.definition: from {{h1692}}; a joint; by implication, solder; joint, solder.

h1695.definition: from {{h1692}}; adhering; cleave, joining, stick closer.

h1696.definition: a primitive root; perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue; answer, appoint, bid, command, commune, declare, destroy, give, name, promise, pronounce, rehearse, say, speak, be spokesman, subdue, talk, teach, tell, think, use (entreaties), utter, × well, × work.

h1697.definition: from {{h1696}}; a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause; act, advice, affair, answer, × any such (thing), because of, book, business, care, case, cause, certain rate,   chronicles, commandment, × commune(-ication),   concern(-ing),   confer, counsel,   dearth, decree, deed, × disease, due, duty, effect,   eloquent, errand, (evil favoured-) ness,   glory,   harm, hurt,   iniquity,   judgment, language,   lying, manner, matter, message, (no) thing, oracle, × ought, × parts,   pertaining,   please, portion,   power, promise, provision, purpose, question, rate, reason, report, request, × (as hast) said, sake, saying, sentence,   sign,   so, some (uncleanness), somewhat to say,   song, speech, × spoken, talk, task,   that, × there done, thing (concerning), thought,   thus, tidings, what(-soever),   wherewith, which, word, work.

h1698.definition: from {{h1696}} (in the sense of destroying); a pestilence; murrain, pestilence, plague.

h1699.definition: from {{h1696}} (in its original sense); a pasture (from its arrangement of the flock); fold, manner.

h1700.definition: feminine of {{h1697}}; a reason, suit or style; cause, end, estate, order, regard.
